Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Avenue \Av"e*nue\, n. [F. avenue, fr. avenir to come to, L. advenire. See {Advene}.] 1. A way or opening for entrance into a place; a passage by which a place may by reached; a way of approach or of exit. ``The avenues leading to the city by land.'' --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
On every side were expanding new avenues of inquiry. --Milman. [1913 Webster]
2. The principal walk or approach to a house which is withdrawn from the road, especially, such approach bordered on each side by trees; any broad passageway thus bordered. [1913 Webster]
An avenue of tall elms and branching chestnuts. --W. Black. [1913 Webster]
3. A broad street; as, the Fifth Avenue in New York. [1913 Webster]
avenue n 1: a line of approach; "they explored every avenue they could think of"; "it promises to open new avenues to understanding" 2: a wide street or thoroughfare [syn: {boulevard}]
